documents.title: market praised for working with students
text: charnwood borough council has said the market was praised for supporting traders with the `` try a trade '' offer .
this means people can have a free stall on the market for a day and then get 50 % off a stall for three months to help grow the business .
the authority said the awards also recognised the market 's work with loughborough university - it 's after traders spent a day at the campus and students held a lecture in the marketplace .

documents.title: women given cameras to photograph food
text: professor paula griffiths from loughborough will be working in two ghanaian cities - accra and ho .
she 'll give cameras to 32 women from poor communities and for one week they 'll be asked to take photos that `` reflect things about what they eat and drink '' .
professor griffiths said : we want to capture the good things that already exist in their community , as well as the things that need to change to help people lead more healthy lives . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: can photographs improve diet in ghana ?
text: i do n't know about you but i 'm always seeing photos of people 's meals on social media i 'm also guilty of posting food photos from time to time .
well a professor from loughborough university is part of a research team over in ghana that is encouraging women to take photos of what they eat .
it 's hoped this could help people to make more healthy choices about what they eat .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: background to mccann libel case
text: just to remind you about the mccann 's court case - they had sued ex-detective goncalo amaral for libel after he wrote a book suggesting the couple were involved in their daughter madeleine 's disappearance .
mr amaral had been ordered to pay 500,000 euros in compensation to kate and gerry in 2015 but this was overturned following an appeal last year .

the mccanns then took the case to portugal 's supreme court - we found out yesterday they had lost their case , with the judge ruling the allegations are protected by freedom of expression laws and were n't abusive .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mccanns 'extremely disappointed ' by court ruling
text: kate and gerry mccann have commented on the decision taken by portugal 's highest court to throw out their libel case against an ex-detective .
the couple successfully sued goncalo amaral over allegations he made in a book about the disappearance of madeleine but the supreme court has now ruled against the mccanns .
the rothley couple said : `` what we have been told by our lawyers is obviously extremely disappointing .
it is eight years since we brought the action and in that time the landscape has dramatically changed .
`` we will , of course , be discussing the implications of the supreme court ruling with our lawyers in due course . ''
author: Press Association

documents.title: hundreds of applicants for dunelm graduate positions
text: baz patel is from dunelm - he said they 've been doing this leadership programme for the past two years and that it 's produced a good standard of graduates .
they 've had to do a lot before even getting to this stage today .

mr patel said : `` this year we had over 750 applicants and each of the 18 candidates we 've selected has been through a rigorous telephone interview , and a series of psychometric tests and a store insight evening held at our thurmaston store . ''
